questions.question: Q1. When equilibrium is reached inside the two half-cells of the electrochemical cells, what is the net voltage across the electrodes?
Q2. Which of the following is not a generally used electrolyte in the salt bridges used to connect the two half-cells of an electrochemical cell?
Q3. Which of the following factors does not affect the electrode potential of an electrode?
Q4.Why are the saturated solutions of electrolytes for the salt bridge prepared in agar-agar jelly or gelatin?

answers.a: The jelly acts as an electrolyte
answers.b: It helps the electrolytes to mix with the contents of the half cells
answers.c: It helps maintain the electrical polarity between the two half-cell solutions
answers.d: It keeps the electrolyte in semi-solid phase and prevents it from mixing with the two half-cell solutions

questions.question: Q5.Which of the following conditions are satisfied when the cell reaction in the electrochemical cell is spontaneous?
Q6.When the salt bridge is removed from a cell, its voltage?
Q7.The cell constant of a conductivity cell?

answers.a: Changes with a change of concentration of electrolyte
answers.c: Changes with a change of electrolyte

questions.question: Q8.Anodizing creates an oxide layer on the surface of a metal that is:

answers.a: thicker than the naturally occurring oxide
answers.b: thinner than the naturally occurring oxide
answers.c: much lighter than the naturally occurring oxide
answers.d: a more porous surface than the naturally occurring oxide

questions.question: Q9.What is the product formed at the cathode in the electrolysis of aqueous CuSO<sub>4</sub>?

answers.c: Electrode should be of varied pressure
